ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: nor did he urge the feeding of the poor.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Nor urged others to feed the poor.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: nor would he urge the feeding of the poor.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: nor were they concerned with feeding the destitute.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: “And did not urge to feed the needy.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And urged not the feeding of the poor.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Nor did he urge the feeding of the poor.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: and he never urged the feeding of the needy;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And urged not on the feeding of the wretched.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: nor did he feel any urge to feed the needy,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Nor he urged on others the feeding of the poor.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: and he did not urge the feeding of the needy,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: And would not encourage the feeding of the indigent!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And urged not on the feeding of Al-Miskin (the poor),
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: nor did he urge the feeding of the needy.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Nor would he advocate the feeding of the destitute.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Nor did he encourage the feeding of the poor.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [69:34] and never urged the feeding of the needy;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And urged not on the feeding of the wretched) and did not urge on giving alms to the needy,
